title: Summarising text explanations -custom set of features
body:
I have worked with the concept of "**SHAP values**" in several published works. I would like to thank you for your work and your kindness in researching this very interesting subject. Now, I am working with **texts**. However, in the Python programming code (of which I am not an expert) I have reached an '_insurmountable wall_'. My intention is to build a barplot with **a custom set of n-tokens (features), those most interesting for the manager (Airbnb vs Hotels)**. In this regard, could you kindly tell me where I can consul to overcome this difficulty?

I am very grateful for your kindness,
majesus

**Code (Binary classification, i.e., Aribnb -0- vs Hotels -1-):**

```
from transformers import pipeline
import shap
model = pipeline("text-classification", model = "mymodel", return_all_scores=True)

from transformers import BertTokenizer
tokenizer = BertTokenizer.from_pretrained("bert-base-uncased")

explainer = shap.Explainer(model, tokenizer) 
shap_values_overall = explainer(eval_df['text'])

shap.plots.bar(shap_values_overall[:, :, 0].max(0), order=shap.Explanation.argsort.flip, max_display = 10)
shap.plots.bar(shap_values_overall[:, :, 1].max(0), order=shap.Explanation.argsort.flip, max_display = 10)

```
